Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 06:00AM km4candles wrote: Sorry, I didn't mean overstep my bounds.  I was just wondering if any of the stage 4 ladies here had heard of this trial for mets.
Posts.Title: My Mom is on to a new trial km4candles EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: km4candles wrote: My mom found out she had metastatic breast cancer in June of 2009.  She has triple negative breast cancer and was cancer free for 9 years before it came back.  She has several nodes in her lungs that they are concerned about, but due to the location, they can not perform a biopsy.  This is the only place of mets so far.  The pet scan shows uptake in those nodes so they are treating it as mets.  She has been on a clinical trial for the last 9 months and was stable until this last scan Monday.  The CTscan shows one nodule has grown ever so slightly and now they are going to start her on a new trial with "Arumbicin"?  Does anyone know anything about this trial?   She has been on two trials and this will be her third.  She hasn't had any of the "staple" drugs since her mets were discovered, and I'm wondering if this is a mistake to keep trying trials.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Mom is on to a new trial km4candles EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 06:16AM km4candles wrote: Thank you.  Yes my mom had what they refer to as the "Red Devil" back in 2000.  She had 4 rounds of it and was deemed "no evidence of disease".  It reared it's ugly head again in 2009 as a regional occurence in her lymph node in her arm pit.  She bumfuzzeled the doctors as they were surprised that it came back after so long, but nonetheless it did.  She was on a trial with Sutent.  That got rid of the tumour in the armpit, but a scan showed these small nodules on her lung.  We just spent 9 months on a trial that for the life of me I can't remember the name of.  However with this slight change the Oncologist suggested this trial.  Like I said hopefully this will be the one to get back to NED.
Posts.Title: My Mom is on to a new trial km4candles EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2010 03:45PM km4candles wrote: Unfortunately, my mom is TN and was diagnosed with an axilla lymph node tumor 7 years out.  We're lucky that it is not in her organs or bones, but still after 7 years the doctors were a little shocked. She's in a trail using Sutent right now.
Posts.Title: TN Mets after 3 years? JerseyMom Kerrilyn
